question: 払う
sourceAnswer: to{} pay-(e.g.-money,-bill) | brush-off/wipe-away/clear-away/dust-off/cut-off-(e.g.-branches) | drive-away-(e.g.-one's-competitors) | sell-off-(something-unneeded)/dispose-of | pay-(e.g.-attention)/show-(e.g.-respect,-concern) | make-(e.g.-effort,-sacrifice)/expend/exert | move-out-(of-one's-own-place)/vacate | sweep-(e.g.-one's-legs)/knock-aside | make-a-sweeping-stroke-(in-Japanese-calligraphy) | reset-(an-abacus)
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>pay</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to pay</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading comes from the one you learned with the kanji.
